dublin_core.dcvalue: Bruchok, C. B., Bowers, N., Jordan, M. E., Wakefield, W., & Ricca, B. (2018). Relating Social Network Structure to Uncertainty and Social Interaction in an Engineering Design Challenge. In Kay, J. and Luckin, R. (Eds.) Rethinking Learning in the Digital Age: Making the Learning Sciences Count, 13th International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018, Volume 3. London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

Engineering design is inherently uncertain; our goal is to design interactional structures in support of design collaboration that addresses the diverse needs of beginning designers as they are dealing with uncertainty. In this study, we explored how diversifying groups in a cohort of undergraduates, teachers, high school students, and international graduate students influenced how participants clustered within the social network and how this clustering related both to reported uncertainties and to the outcome of their collaborative engineering design challenge.
International Society of the Learning Sciences, Inc. [ISLS].
Relating Social Network Structure to Uncertainty and Social Interaction in an Engineering Design Challenge

collaborative learning
